name: df-trpred
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wceq(ctrpred(c0, c1, c2), cuni(crn(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, ciun(s1, cv(s0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(s1)))), cpred(c0, c1, c2)), com))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ TrPred(c0, c1, c2)= ‚ãÉ ran((rec((s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ ‚ãÉ(s1 ‚àà s0, Pred(c0, c1, s1))), Pred(c0, c1, c2))|` _om))
comment: Define the transitive predecessors of a class ` X ` under a relationship ` R ` and a class ` A ` . This class can be thought of as the "smallest" class containing all elements of ` A ` that are linked to ` X ` by a chain of ` R ` relationships (see ~ trpredtr and ~ trpredmintr ). Definition based off of Lemma 4.2 of Don Monk's notes for Advanced Set Theory, which can be found at ~ http://euclid.colorado.edu/~~monkd/settheory (check The Internet Archive for it now as Prof. Monk appears to have rewritten his website). (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 2-Feb-2011.)
